benchmark_details.name: HalluQA
benchmark_details.overview: HalluQA is a benchmark designed to evaluate hallucination phenomena in Chinese large language models using 450 meticulously crafted adversarial questions, taking into account Chinese historical culture, customs, and social phenomena.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate hallucination issues in Chinese large language models and assist in the development of trustworthy AI.
out_of_scope_uses: Models not related to hallucination evaluation

data.source: Adversarial samples generated based on GLM-130B and ChatGPT
data.annotation: Adversarial nature of questions ensures diverse coverage of hallucination types.

methodology.calculation: The non-hallucination rate is calculated as the percentage of answers generated by models that do not exhibit hallucinations.
methodology.interpretation: A model's performance is assessed based on its ability to produce non-hallucinated responses to adversarial questions.
methodology.baseline_results: 18 out of 24 models achieved non-hallucination rates lower than 50%.
methodology.validation: Evaluations are confirmed through consistency checks with human assessments.
